item.title: Leading Cause of Death in the United States
item.description: In this post I want to review the trend of leading causes of deaths in United States. Specially how fast the age adjusted rate decase in each state. The data come from CDC. The main numer I will use in this post in age-adjusted death rates. Pacakge and Data library(tidyverse) library(jsonlite) library(fuzzyjoin) library(transformr) # devtools::install_github("thomasp85/transformr") library(sf) library(gganimate) library(geofacet) theme_set(theme_minimal()) death_data <- read_csv("/Users/yifeiliu/Documents/R/data/EDA/leading_death.csv") death_data <- death_data %>% dplyr::rename(year = Year, all_cause = `113 Cause Name`, cause = `Cause Name`, state = State, deaths = Deaths, aadr = `Age-adjusted Death Rate`) death_data_processed <- death_data %>% select(- all_cause) %>% dplyr::filter(!

item.title: Analyze U.S. Census Data using Tidycensus
item.description: Just fininsh Tidycensus class on Datacamp which is called Analyzing US Census Data in R so I think it will will a great opportunity for me to practice my data visualization skills. Show Pennsylvania Median Income You need to obtain a API code from U.S. Census and set it up in .Rprofile. library(tidyverse) library(tidycensus) library(ggplot2) library(purrr) library(dplyr) library(shiny) library(viridis) library(tmap) library(sf) library(plotly) # devtools::install_github('thomasp85/gganimate') library(gganimate) # census_api_key(key = "Your API Keys") library(ggthemes) library(mapview) Next we need to find median income data, you can use load_variables function to find the variables name that you want to find, you can also use Census Reporter to browser different categories of data.
